body: I have same problem.  Are there any solution to solve it?
Thank you for sending the great feedback! ORT is not supporting using multiple GPUs well in inference right now. We'll add the support later and update this issue once it's well supported.
Is there an ETA for fixing this particular operator? This is breaking the models that were okay with multi-GPU previously...

issue.title: ONNX model gets much slower on rel-0.5.0 compared to rel-0.4.0

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
The same model takes much longer to run on ONNX Runtime rel-0.5.0 compares to running on rel-0.4.0

**Urgency**
None

**System information**
- OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04): 18.04
- ONNX Runtime installed from (source or binary): source
- ONNX Runtime version: 0.5.0
- Python version: 3.6.9
- Visual Studio version (if applicable):
- GCC/Compiler version (if compiling from source): gcc (Ubuntu 7.4.0-1ubuntu1~18.04.1) 7.4.0
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 10
- GPU model and memory: TITAN V

**To Reproduce**
- Run in docker image built from [Dockerfile.cuda](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/dockerfiles/Dockerfile.cuda) in proper release version branch
- After unzipping the file from link in "additional context", run `perf_client_decoder_onnx_runtime.py` script, and latency will be printed once the script is finished

**Expected behavior**
The latency should be the same as running on rel-0.4.0, but it is more than 10x slower:
rel-0.5.0
```
5.224515144220607
Latency average (seconds) = 5.2252
Latency cl 50 (seconds) = 5.2356
Latency cl 90 (seconds) = 5.3368
Latency cl 95 (seconds) = 5.3922
Latency cl 99 (seconds) = 5.6429
Latency cl 100 (seconds) = 6.1242
```
rel-0.4.0
```
0.2804932994043042
Latency average (seconds) = 0.2805
Latency cl 50 (seconds) = 0.2762
Latency cl 90 (seconds) = 0.2947
Latency cl 95 (seconds) = 0.2999
Latency cl 99 (seconds) = 0.3504
Latency cl 100 (seconds) = 0.5494
```
**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Additional context**
Link to the model and client:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1r_3nHM-bBR_lyiezfsJhPsoOSdN29Afb/view?usp=sharing

issue.body:
**Description**: Describe your changes.
There's are some place hard code the device_id to 0 while using AsyncBuffer which makes it run into issue user want to use device other than device_id 0.

https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1592

issue.title: Is TensorRT EP not included in rel-0.4.0?

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
I tried to build ONNX Runtime C library with TensorRT Execution provider from source, it built and I compiled my simple example successfully, but it failed to execute with the following error:
```
./ort_c_api: relocation error: ./ort_c_api: symbol OrtSessionOptionsAppendExecutionProvider_Tensorrt version VERS_0.4.0 not defined in file libonnxruntime.so.0.4.0 with link time reference
```

I build the library using the following script (modified from [Dockerfile.tensorrt](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/dockerfiles/Dockerfile.tensorrt)). Note that I actually use a specific commit that is between rel-0.4.0 and rel-0.5.0, and everything is fine if I build on latest master by uncommenting `git reset` (i.e. my example code can run without the above error). But unfortunately I couldn't use latest master in my project as #1592 is still ongoing. I wonder if I am doing something wrong as the release note said TensorRT EP is in rel-0.4.0

```Dockerfile
FROM nvcr.io/nvidia/tensorrt:19.08-py3
MAINTAINER Vinitra Swamy "viswamy@microsoft.com"

ARG ONNXRUNTIME_REPO=https://github.com/Microsoft/onnxruntime
ARG ONNXRUNTIME_SERVER_BRANCH=master

RUN apt-get update &&\
    apt-get install -y sudo git bash

WORKDIR /code
ENV PATH /usr/local/nvidia/bin:/usr/local/cuda/bin:/code/cmake-3.14.3-Linux-x86_64/bin:/opt/miniconda/bin:${PATH}

# Prepare onnxruntime repository & build onnxruntime with TensorRT
RUN git clone --recursive ${ONNXRUNTIME_REPO} onnxruntime &&\
    cp onnxruntime/dockerfiles/scripts/install_common_deps.sh /code/. &&\
    cp onnxruntime/dockerfiles/LICENSE-IMAGE.txt /code/LICENSE-IMAGE.txt &&\
    cp onnxruntime/ThirdPartyNotices.txt /code/ThirdPartyNotices.txt

# reset hard seems dumb, but checkout fails as some files shown "modified"
# due to CRLF line endings
RUN /bin/sh /code/install_common_deps.sh
ARG COMMON_BUILD_ARGS="--parallel --build_shared_lib --use_openmp"
RUN cd onnxruntime &&\
    git reset --hard 2f698bd54b713bb87dbd0bbb913e94bcf7fd480c && \
    git submodule update --init --recursive && \
    /bin/sh ./build.sh --cuda_home /usr/local/cuda --cudnn_home /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/ --use_tensorrt --tensorrt_home /workspace/tensorrt --config Release $COMMON_BUILD_ARGS --build_wheel --update --build --cmake_extra_defines ONNXRUNTIME_VERSION=$(cat ./VERSION_NUMBER) &&\
    pip install /code/onnxruntime/build/Linux/Release/dist/*.whl

```

issue.title: Fix the cuda allocator not work for multi-devices issue

repository.name: onnxruntime
repository.description: ONNX Runtime: cross-platform, high performance ML inferencing and training accelerator

issue.body:
Fix issue https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1592

We have some place hard coded the device id to 0 for the allocator.

body:
I've merged my pull request to master. With this change you can run a model on a device other than device 0. But it's still not possible to run multiple model in same thread but on different device, because the cudaSetDevice works with thread scope. more details refer to this link:
https://devblogs.nvidia.com/cuda-pro-tip-always-set-current-device-avoid-multithreading-bugs/

so, from your sample code, there's a session using device 0, then another session using device 1. When the program runs, it will use device 1 for these 2 sessions finally. To make it able to run on different device within same thread, there are more work to be done. e.g. need to re-call cudaSetDevice before every cuda kernel and cuda allocator.

For now, you can create and run different session in different threads, that is no problem.

Let us know if you still have some concerns on this.

Thanks for the fix, I will try it out later and close the issue.

And regarding the multiple devices issue you pointed out, does this [workaround](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1034#issuecomment-497184636) work the same as "create and run different session in different threads"? In this workaround, I will create the sessions in different threads, but I will only use one thread to distribute requests to different sessions.

issue.title: Advance ONNX Runtime version to a fixed commit after rel-0.5.0

repository.name: server
repository.description: The Triton Inference Server provides an optimized cloud and edge inferencing solution.

issue.body:
The commit includes fixes to:
* [deploying model across multiple GPUs](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1592)
* [building ONNX Runtime C libraray with TensorRT Execution Provider](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1803)
* [ONNX Runtime slowdown due to tensor copies between CPU and GPU](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/issues/1675)

body: @HectorSVC Thanks, I have verified that the issue is fixed, closing the issue now. By the way, it seems like multi-GPU work without using the workaround: I created sessions for the same model on different GPUs and send requests to them, the GPU memory usage and utilization increases roughly the same amount on both GPUs
